definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.english: Random fixed point theorems are of fundamental importance in probabilistic functional analysis.
sentences.chinese: 隨機不動點定理在隨機泛函分析中起重要作用。

sentences.english: There are data sets in iteration that converge to single points, called attractive fixed points.
sentences.chinese: 在迭代過程中有數據集匯聚成單點，叫做吸性不動點。

sentences.english: Given a function and an input, find the fixed point.
sentences.chinese: 提供了一個函數和一個輸入，找到不動點。

sentences.english: By choosing proper cones and using the fixed point theorem of cone expansion and compression, we prove the existence of positive solutions.
sentences.chinese: 利用錐拉壓不動點定理，獲得了其正解的存在性。

sentences.english: Some new fixed point theorems are obtained as a consequence of this coincidence theorem.
sentences.chinese: 由這疊合定理還導出了一些新的不動點定理。
